bullets.text: Federal judge rules Trump can’t unilaterally halt Gateway Tunnel funding, reducing near-term risk to a major Northeast rail/infrastructure megaproject.
U.S.-Iran talks: Trump demands zero Iranian enriched uranium; Iran calls talks a “good start,” but escalation risk keeps markets focused on brinkmanship.
Oil prices jitter on reports of heightened U.S. strike risk against Iran; risk premium could reprice quickly despite currently low oil levels.
U.S. equities rebound after volatility; Dow hits 50,000, underscoring strong risk appetite even amid concentrated tech drawdowns.
AI “bubble” fears drive Big Tech sell-off; scrutiny intensifies on whether massive AI capex can generate near-term cash flow returns.
Tech AI spending may approach ~$700B in 2026; investors flag cash burn and payback periods as key valuation constraints.
Nvidia jumps after CEO argues ~$660B AI capex buildout is sustainable, reframing capex as multi-year infrastructure rather than a short-cycle boom.
Bitcoin whipsaws back above $70k after near-$60k break; leveraged borrowing against crypto amplifies systemic liquidation and credit contagion risks.
America’s EV pullback risks ceding battery/materials supply chains to China, deepening China’s pricing power and industrial-policy leverage in autos.
Haiti faces a governance vacuum as gangs tighten control, raising regional security and migration pressures with limited state capacity to stabilize.
EU orders TikTok to disable “addictive” features like infinite scroll and adjust recommendations, signaling tougher platform-design regulation with ad-revenue implications.
Cyber risk: China-linked “Salt Typhoon” intrusions hit Norwegian firms, highlighting persistent state-backed espionage exposure for European industry and critical suppliers.
Public-health evidence: century-long hair-sample analysis shows lead levels plunged after leaded-gas bans, reinforcing the large returns from environmental regulation.
Biomedical advances: a newly identified antibacterial sugar shows promise against drug-resistant superbugs, potentially expanding antibiotic options as resistance accelerates.
